title: i kicked pregnant sister out
story: I kicked pregnant sister out after unforgivable demand - its her fault shes homelessThe -year-old woman kicked her younger sister out her house after she abandoned her beloved husky on the other side of the city - and is now receiving backlash from her friends and familyHer pregnant sister wouldnt stop complaining about her dogImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar |commentsWhen turning to your family for help, itaposs important to show your appreciation while trying to improve your situation. As when somebodyaposs kindness is taken for granted, they can grow tired of helping - even when itaposs a blood relative. One woman ended up kicking her pregnant sister out her house after she tried to change her lestyle.Venting to Reddit, the woman explained how her sister abandoned her beloved dog on the other side of the city because she didnapost want a wild animal around her newborn.She said: Last year my -year-old sister was kicked out of her boyfriendaposs house and I took her in.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.  We donapost have the best relationship but she was jobless and I was the only relative still living in our country. Surprise, surprise... about two months later she figured out she was pregnant. Her sister began to complain about her two-year-old husky, who is said to be a total sweetheart. She was saying how it would be bad for her baby and that she wouldnapost raise her kid with a aposwild animalapos around, she added. I told her it was my house andshe wasnapost comfortable here, she could leave and my dog was staying no matter what. She kept complaining but I wouldnapost change my mind. It was when the woman was working away when her sister drove to the other side of the city with the husky, tied him up to a railing and drove back home without him. When I came back my dog was not home and my sister claimed she had no idea where he was. We got into a fight because I didnapost believe her, she said.  I ended up storming off and asked a few neighboursthey had seen him. One told me that last time he saw him was when my sister took him somewhere a few days ago. She uses my Uber account because sheaposs broke so when I found an odd trip to the other side of the city, I connected the dots. After driving miles in search for her beloved dog, the woman spent hours asking strangers in the street whether theyaposd seen a husky wandering around. The -year-old added: I found my dog in a street restaurant, the owner took him after a aposblonde pregnant womanapos left him leashed to a fence. I ended up explaining the situation, paying him like £ and I got my dog back. When I went back home I kicked out my sister, I gave her enough money for a week in a hotel and sent her on her merry way, she made a huge scandal and I admit I was a bit too forceful but I was furious. She called all my family and friends and theyaposre all telling me Iaposm an a****** for picking my dog over my sister and that I should take her back, that I should value that unborn baby more than a silly animal. I think my dog is more important and what my sister did is unforgivable. While some users said the woman should have picked her pregnant sister over her dog, most users agreed she was in the right to kick her out. One user said: I think you should have driven her across the city and tied her to a fence instead of paying for her hotel room. You had to buy your dog back, paying for her hotel on top of it is over the top. What she did is beyond disturbing. Another added: The fact that she even felt like this was OK blows my mind. Her sister is a guest in her home, one that doesn’t get to dictate who lives there. You should tell your family and friends to take in your sister then. Youaposve done her part in sheltering her this far. A third added: People like to take out their problems on the most innocent and helpless beings and they adore the aposbut it’s just a silly animalapos or aposstill just a dog, cat, hedgehog, and so onapos and they have the nerve to expect empathy from others. Do you have a dog story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. title: man convinced hes spotted ufo
story: Man convinced hes spotted a UFO hovering over Arctic Ocean on Google EarthEdward Jones was thrilled to spot what he thought looked like an otherworldly UFO off the coast of the Norwegian archipelago of Svalbard - but others werent as convincedEdward Jones believes the weird and shadowy shape is a UFO Image: Kennedy News Google EarthByBen ThompsonCharlie Duffield:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A man is convinced he has spotted a UFO flying above the Arctic ocean on Google Earth.Office manager Edward Jones was confused when he spotted the mysterious figure hovering off the coast of the Norwegian archipelago of Svalbard.He claims to have spotted UFOs in the past, and shared his finding on Facebook - but other users werenapost so convinced.People made all sorts of weird and wonderful claims as to what the shadowy shape was, including that it was Jesus, Michael Jackson, a Star Wars spaceship or even a passing seagull. Edward believes itaposs none of these options, claiming that it doesnapost look from this earth. He said: When Iaposm bored, Iaposll go on Google Earth, and look around at dferent locations that youaposre never going to see [in real le]. I was just being nosey and I was having a look up around Greenland and the Arctic. One of the shots was on a boat and I spotted it when I zoomed in. It didnapost look like anything Iaposd ever seen and I couldnapost understand what it was in the middle of the sea.  Iaposm a big believer in UFOs, Iaposve seen a few with my own eyes. I couldnapost say what it is. The way itaposs flying, itaposs sort of vertical, not horizontal like a plane. But Edwardaposs post was greeted with a lot of skepticism. He explained: Thereaposs quite a few non-believers in the group. I put it up and people started saying all sorts. I donapost know why non-believers are in that grouptheyaposre just going to slate everything. I know what I saw and it wasnapost a seagull, I never saw a seagull that looked like that. Some people said it looked like a body ascending, like Jesus. One person even said it looked like Michael Jackson doing his hat-off pose. I donapost think itaposs a body ascending and I definitely donapost think itaposs Michael Jackson. Itaposs just something I canapost identy, so Iaposd classy it as a UFO. Personally I thinkaliens were to be anywhere on the planet, theyaposd be up around places like Greenland or Antarctica. I definitely think itaposs not from this earth. Andit is from Earth, the only other thing I think it could be is something the military are working on. They could be testing somewhere out there, like a drone or something we havenapost seen yet. Whenever I see UFOs I get excited, Iaposve seen a few of them over the years. I look up more than most people, so maybe thataposs why Iaposm always seeing them.Edwardaposs sightings were met with a mix of mockery and cynicism. One person wrote: That is very clearly the Lord and saviour himself. A second said: Looks like a body either ascending or descending. Another commented: My God. Itaposs clearly a seagull. One wrote: Ah yes, such high-resolution imagery means that we can instantly identy anything in the sky. Definitely a UFO because itaposs impossible to very what it wasthese are the only images. Another commented: No UFO. Looks like a Johnny. And one remarked: Itaposs Bobba Fett in Slave One. story: McDonalds fans creeped out as demonic painting discovered near chain headquartersA disturbing McDonald’s painting - dubbed Pennywises cousin - has been found less than  metres away from the fast-food chain’s London headquarters, and some fear that it may be cursedThe painting has let people seriously creeped out Image: Triangle NewsByJulia BanimAudience WriterJosie O’Brien:,  Mar |comments A disturbing McDonald’s painting has been found less than  metres away from the fast-food chain’s London headquarters, depicting an evil Ronald McDonald grabbing onto a terried child. In the painting, spotted in the window of an RSPCA a five-minute walk from the headquarters, Ronald is shown to have sharp teeth and claws, and looks more like the villain from It than the cheerful Happy Meal mascot known the world over. People have since dubbed the chilling portrait as ‘Pennywise’s cousin’, expressing fears that it might be aposcursedapos. Some have even called for it to be burned, believing it to be haunted. The painting caught the eye of amateur comedian Ivan Kirby, as he walked along High Road, Finchley, north London on Monday, March . Given the proximity to McDonaldaposs headquarters, he couldnapost help but wonderthataposs where it originated from. Ivan, who clocked the framed artwork in the window of East Finchley’s RSPCA shop has since joked that it was a bit of a bargain, with a reasonable £ price tag. A signature in the right-hand corner of the picture points towards it having been painted in , meaning the previous owner wouldnapost have kept it in their possession for more than four years.Ivan has since shared his creepy find on Facebook, where his followers were left completely horried.Amanda Hadfield wrote: “No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no. story: Mum orders £, Uber to Ukraine to help after having one too many pink ginsA mum has claimed she ordered an Uber to Ukraine as she wanted to help out after having one too many drinks but was saved from the £, bill as she had insufficient fundsLeoni drunkenly wanted to help Image: Kennedy News and MediaByCourtney PochinSenior Audience WriterSophie Norris:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsWith all thataposs going on in Ukraine at the moment, itaposs understandable that many people are keen to help however they can.And one mum recently decided she was going to do just that, ordering an Uber to take her straight from Swinton, Greater Manchester, to Ukraine after having aposone too manyapos drinks on a night out.Leoni Fildes had been out celebrating her friendaposs birthday on Saturday, March  when her group started chatting about Ukraine.The mum-of-two was askedher boyfriend, who is in the military, might be forced to fightthe UK entered the war and she proclaimed thathe did, she would go with him.The -year-old, who owns a dog grooming business, says sheaposd had a aposfew double pink gins and shots of Sambucaapos at this point, as well as a bottle of prosecco, and drunkenly decided to take action. She opened up the Uber app to book a taxi - a trip that would cost her a whopping £,.Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.Leoni was thankfully saved from her drunken impulse due to having aposinsufficient fundsapos in her account - however, Uber still tried to take the payment nine times. The following morning the mum had flashbacks of her risky mistake after her bank called to warn her about fraudulent activity on her card. She says sheaposs now glad she didnapost have enough money in her account and has questioned what could have happenedshe had embarked on the trip. Leoni said: Iaposm  - I should know better. The next day I didnapost remember doing it. I was like aposoh my godapos. I woke up to my bank ringing me, thinking my card had been [used fraudulently]. Uber tried to take the payment nine times out of my account. They were pretty determined. I had a little flashback when the bank called and I said aposI think it was me - sorryapos. Normally, Uber allow a trip in advance but theyaposve recently stopped it so I was lucky. I remember when we were looking, we said aposoh, weaposll get the comfort oneapos. Thataposs dearer - the XL one.If Leoni had ordered a regular UberX taxi, it would have cost her between £, and £,, butshe had splurged out on an UberXL, it would have cost between £, and £,. Leoni explained: Iaposd gone out with one of my friends in Swinton. We came up with the conversation about the war in Ukraine. One too many drinks later, we were trying to get a taxi home. We said aposshall we get a taxi and go help themapos. Weaposd been out for about four hours so Iaposd had a few double pink gins and quite a lot of shots of Sambuca and a bottle of prosecco. I think that might have tipped me over the edge. I donapost know what Iaposd doUber had let me order it. I donapost think Iaposd have got in but you donapost know after a drink. I might have piled into the taxi and realised when we got further out. It would have been coming out of my account and I donapost know where Iaposd have woken up. After weaposd done that, I couldnapost get a taxi for about an hour and a half. They were allowing me to go to Ukraine but not  minutes up the road back home. It was only about . and I had to ring a few dferent taxi companies then to get a taxi. I got in at about . An Uber spokesperson added: We can confirm that no trip requests were successfully made in this instance. We are looking into this further to understand what happened.Do you have a story to share  We pay for stories. story: Mum ticked off as kidsfrom school with cheeky PTA fundraising instructionsA mum has been left feeling annoyed after her children ed home from school and nursery with Smarties from the PTA - and instructions to fill the tube with moneyThe kids ed from school with fundraising instructionsImage: Getty Images EyeEmByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsItaposs no secret that having kids can be expensive - thereaposs just so much to pay for. And when it comes time for them to start school, things get even pricier, with new unorms, lunches, pencil cases and school trips to pay for. So when her children recently came home from their nursery and school asking for more money, itaposs fair to say one parent was left feeling rather ticked off. Sharing her story anonymously online, the mum explained that the schoolaposs PTAhad sent the kids home with a tube of Smarties each. The children were instructed to eat the sweets and then fill the tube up with £ in either £ coins or  pence pieces.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here. Writing in a post on Mumsnet, the woman askedshe was being unreasonable to not want to do it. She said: Both children came home from school and nursery today with a tube of smarties each as a gt from the PTA with instructions to eat them and fill the tube with £ coins or p, letter specically states not coppers or  ps. Apparently, the tube will hold £ of pences.There will be a prize for the class who brings back the most money.The mum-of-two goes on to say that she has a few issues with the fundraising plan - including that the PTA didnapost consult parents on the plan before going ahead with it, her children didnapost need the extra chocolate and that her family are skint due to the cost of childcare. Partner and I both work but childcare and other costs are crippling us at the moment and weaposre skint, an extra £ is really beyond us just now, she explained, as she listed reasons why she was against the idea. Weaposve just paid £ snack money to nursery and £ for a school trip for one and £ for a trip for another . Does anyone even have coins lying around the house anymore  I use contactless payment for almost everything and donapost draw out cash.  The parent added that she now feels guilty as her children feel they need to raise money for the school.The children have been hyped up about it and both have said they need to raise money for the school. I guess Iaposm feeling guilty that weaposre not in a position to participate itaposs a pain in the a**e idea.More than  people responded to the post, with many agreeing it was a cheeky thing for the PTA school to do. One person said: A prize for whoever brings back the most money! Given how many children are living in poverty in the UK currently, this is a really grim exercise. I know that schools are short on cash, but this just seems cruel! Another replied: Itaposs a bad idea for fundraising. Itaposs too much money per child family and the competition aspect pits too much pressure on people to take part. The aposnot papos bit is bloody cheeky! A third wrote: Itaposs a shame that schools are being driven to this. It makes me so annoyed. You donapost have a choice but to ignore it. title: my baby daddys fiance annoyed
story: My baby daddys fiancée is annoyed that I wont let her name our childA mum-to-be has been left in a bit of a predicament after her childs fathers fiancée failed to understand why she wasnt allowed the final say in the naming of the baby, believing this to be "her child too"" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _Woman-Choosing-Baby-Names-In-Nursery.jpg" width"" "" The fiancée wants to name the baby after her fatherImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByJulia BanimAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments An expectant mother says sheaposs has had to have some dficult conversations with her childaposs fatheraposs fiancée, who believes she should have a say in the naming of the unborn child.The -year-old mum-to-be claims to have become pregnant after having a threesome with the babyaposs father, Jasper, , and his fiancée, Maddy, . She says there was no cheating involved, and that she has never slept with just Jasper, or just Maddy.Sadly, Jasper and Maddy lost their first child a year ago, and the pregnant woman has stated that sheaposs tried to be mindful of their loss, making attempts to be accomodating where and when she can. However, she claims that she has also had to lay down some ground rules, making it clear that Maddy canapost treat her like sheaposs a surrogate while emphasising that sheaposll be the stepmother, not the adoptive mother.Maddy has previously pushed to be allowed in the delivery room during the birth, but sheaposs stood firm on this, telling her that only Jasper and her mum will be present. Although she can make suggestions, Maddy also wonapost be permitted to make any big decisions for the child unless in the case of an emergency.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. According to the conflicted mother-to-be, all three of them are well aware that their situation is uncommon, knowing that they will just have to learn along the way.Taking to Reddit, she explained how things got more complicated after the three of them headed out to dinner a few days back. Jasper asked her whether sheaposd had any thoughts about baby names, and she handed him a list, inviting him and Maddy to make suggestions.It was at this point that Maddy apparently offered a few thoughts of her own, but couldnapost understand why these wouldnapost be automatically accepted. The poster - who goes by the username u SaltyShock - I told them they can add some names to it and then we three could discuss them and choose one. Maddy told me she wanted to give them her dadaposs name as a middle name since it was special to her.Iaposll be honest, I donapost like the idea because a family nameseems very personal. Also, I didnapost like that she behaved like the decision was set since thataposs not our deal. Jasper didnapost seem that fond of the idea either so I told her that, while we could consider it and think about it, I wasnapost sure. She continued: Maddy got quite p***y and said that it wasnapost fair that she wasnapost allowed to have or say anything without passing it through the aposmom policeapos because this was her child too. She canapost be in the delivery room, she wonapost give birth to them or have any legal rights and the least I could do is let her have the middle name. Jasper tried to argue with Maddy, but she refused to listen, taking her things and leaving the restaurant. The poster and Jasper stayed for a little while longer, during which time he apologised before driving her back to her own home. The posteraposs mother has now said that she understands Maddyaposs perspective, telling her daughter that she may as well let her have the middle name, as it really doesnapost matter as much as the first one anyway. Clarying the situation, the pregnant woman explained that she has slept with Jasper and Maddy three times since finding out she was expecting but stated that this doesnapost make them partners, with the couple having their own separate relationship.One fellow Reddit user wrote: I am sorry that the woman lost a child, but this is your child. Itaposs all % yours. She will be the stepmother. She will have a special place in your childaposs le, but the honour of naming your child is not in that role.The major decisions are yours and she needs to completely understand that, or there will definitely be more problems. Another commented: I think people are being a little harsh on her. Imagine you decide to have a threesome or one-night stand and your fiancé gets the other girl pregnant. Yikes. Iaposm sureyou didnapost plan on maintaining a relationship , neither did she, so I can understand her acting a little out of pocket. The girl needs some support therapy to work through the situation. Or maybe she doesnapost, but I know I sure as hell would.Do you have a baby name-related story to share  We pay for stories. title: my mum demanded move wedding
story: My mum demanded I move my wedding - she wants reception to be her birthday partyA bride-to-be has been left furious after her mum demanded she move her wedding forward by a year - so that the reception could double as her th birthday partyThe woman was baffled by her mums requestImage: Getty ImagesByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar |commentsWeddings are usually the perfect time for family members to get together and celebrate, andyour family donapost host regular meetups, they also serve as great occasions for catching up on the lives of your loved ones.But ultimately, a wedding day should primarily be about celebrating the couple who are tying the knot. This is why one woman on Reddit has been left furious after her own mum demanded she move her entire wedding forward by a year - so that the reception can double as her th birthday party.Posting her story anonymously, the bride-to-be said she put her foot down and denied her mumaposs request, and was shocked when her mum was actually upset by her decision.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. She wrote: The day my fiancé and I set a date for our wedding, my mother pulled us to the side and askedwe would be willing to move the wedding up an entire year, so she could use our reception as her th birthday party. She thought it would be fun. We would get the ceremony, she’d have the reception, and everyone would be happy. I just don’t understand how someone could even ask that. I understand the whole aposno one cares as much about your wedding as you doapos thing, but this feels ridiculous. I feel like out of anyone other than my fiancé and I, my mom should be one of the people most excited, right  But she just cares about having a big birthday party, and she’s actually upset that we said no. To her taking over our wedding to throw herself a party. I will never understand her thinking, and I’m sure she’s going to bring it up again. Or do something  to make my wedding day about her. It’s what she does best, after all. Commenters on the Reddit post were equally baffled by the mumaposs actions, as many said she canapost commandeer the womanaposs wedding day for her own party. One person said: Thataposs a terrible thing for her to think and an even worse thing to actually ask of you and your fiancé! Why donapost you tell her to throw her bday party and youaposll have your wedding in the middle of it, see how she likes that idea. Iaposm so sorry your mum is acting like that, you and your fiancé deserve to have the wedding day you want, exactly how you want it. I hope you guys have an amazing wedding that is all about YOU! As another wrote: That’s crazy narcissistic. Your wedding day is for you and your partner, she can’t just commandeer it. Wow. There are no words. It’s beyond selfish, a third added.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON MarriageWeddingsBirthday partyWedding day" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news tipping-point-big-win-sends-"Pub erupts in cheers after Tipping Point contestant wins counterByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments This hilarious video shows the moment a packed pub erupts into joyous celebration as a contestant wins big on TV game show Tipping Point.It seems that every drinker in the Hatfield House Bar was engrossed in the ITV game show and they were on the edge of their seats as a player named John was on the verge of winning £,.TikTok user Danny McElvanna, @dannymcelvanna, managed to capture some footage of the scene, just as John secures the win and the whole pub explodes - with cheering emerging coming from every corner. And even host Ben Shephard was left in stitches when he was shown the clip on Good Morning Britain, adding I think we need to go there for a pint!  What do you think about the celebration  Let us know in the comments...In the clip, punters in the pub in Belfast, Ireland, are clearly feeling the tension as contestant John answers questions to earn counters, which are then placed into a giant coin pusher. People begin shouting “go on” at the pub’s TV, and a small cheer can be heard as a few coins fall over the sides - but thataposs nothing compared to whataposs to come.  Johnaposs luck continues as the jackpot counter - a gold coin with a red star- then falls over the side, and the whole pub erupts. In scenes resembling the Hyde Park celebration when England scored a goal in the World Cup, people can be seen jumping in the air, cheering, as drinks struggle to stay in their glasses. Dannyaposs video has been viewed over , times and had over a thousand comments, mostly from people blown away by the footage. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. One said: This is Tipping Point heritage. Then a second added: Phenomenal. And a third wrote: This country is unreal. You will never see anything like this again, commented another TikTok user. So watch it, breath it in. Soon the popularity of the clip spread beyond social media and Good Morning Britainaposs Richard Arnold shared the clip with Tipping Point host Ben Shephard. Watching the clip, he said I got sent that yesterday from Dannyaposs TikTok account and Iaposm not on TikTok and someone said, aposBen have you watched this apos I think itaposs a pub called the Hatfield in Belfast and all the students get together, I think they watch Tipping Point and then they watch The Chase and they have a big event. But then what better way to celebrate a jackpot than with a pint  I think we need to go there for a pint! title: woman perplexed date takes pub
story: Woman perplexed as date takes her to a pub - but dumps her because she drinksA woman has been left baffled after she went on a date to a pub and was having fun with the bloke - until he dumped her because he doesnt date girls who drinkThe woman thought she was having fun while on her dateImage: Getty Images WestendByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar |commentsAlmost all of us have been on at least one rubbish date, but have you ever had a partner take you somewhere just to seeyouaposll do something they donapost like Thataposs exactly what happened to one woman on Reddit, who claimed a date took her out for a night of drinking and then dumped her because he doesnapost date girls who drink.Posting her story anonymously, the woman said the bloke had convinced her to stay out with him to seeshe could keep up with his partying ways, but was later told it was actually just a test - and he expected her to put her foot down and refuse to drink.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. She also claimed she drank more that night than she would normally do and thought she and her date were just having fun, so was shocked to discover she had been lied to. She wrote: I donapost know why but Iaposm getting flashbacks to the guy who, a few years ago, tried on a good one with me . We had a great time, and he kept saying how much he was enjoying himself. He later texted me saying he doesnapost date girls who drink that much, though he really liked me. He said, aposI think youaposre still at a place where you party way more than meapos, which made me realise him saying he wanted to stay out and keep going apos I could keep upapos was a test.  I canapost roll my eyes hard enough at the double standards. Especially considering that night was far crazier than anything in my le. I thought we were both feeling a vibe and having fun. The woman shared her experience after being reminded of it while waiting for another date to start - because the man had told her he was running late after confirming the time they were due to meet just hours before. She said: Itaposs small, but he called me yesterday to confirm the time. He texted me today to say he was excited and reconfirm.  And now itaposs the time. Iaposm at the place weaposre supposed to meet. And he texted methat he was running late. Weaposre in an area with no traffic. Dating should be fun. Not confusing. And commenters on the Reddit post were quick to share their own stories of dating disasters, as it was soon revealed that many of them had been through similar scenarios. One person said: I think a lot of men also test boundaries early on to see what you’ll tolerate. If you don’t say anything, they take it as a go-ahead to continue such behaviour. I’ve known countless women who try to play it cool in the beginning because they don’t want to seem high maintenance. Then they end up in a relationship with someone who engages in unacceptable behaviour. While another added: I literally just left a date because the guy was super late. He was straight-up  minutes late. He still didn’t show up  minutes after telling me he was looking for parking. He was either standing me up or he really didn’t respect me or my time. Perhaps he was also testing how long I would wait. Creating tests is toxic behaviour. People need to use their words like an adult, a third stated.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON DatingUmm what " data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: 109 empty prams placed square
story: empty prams placed in square to mark each child slaughtered by Putins forcesIn Rynok square, Lviv,  empty prams were placed out to commemorate each of the innocent children slaughtered by Vladimir Putins forces since their invasion of Ukraine beganThe  prams in Lviv are a poignant symbol Image: Anadolu Agency via Getty ImagesByKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments  empty baby prams were placed in a square in the centre of the Ukrainian city of Lviv, to mark each of the children slaughtered by Vladimir Putinaposs forces since the Russian invasion began.The heartbreaking images show rows and rows of empty prams of ious colours, set out in the Rynok square in the historic western Ukrainian city under blue skies. Each one of the prams is empty and represents a child killed since February , and a family mourning their tragic loss. The eerie picture is a timely reminder of the human cost of the Kremlinaposs actions. The prams were put behind rails to keep them undisturbed and to allow passers-by to see them.Want all the latest news and analysis from Ukraine to our World News Bulletinhere Mayor of Lviv Andriy Sadovyi said:  kids.  kids have been killed by Russians since the day one of full-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine.Empty prams on Rynok Square in Lviv today symbolize the lives of little angels. They are now defending Ukraine’sky instead of decisive actions of the world. His words echoed Ukraineaposs calls for the west to turn the countryaposs airspace into a no-fly zone. However, western leaders like Joe Biden have always said that they would never take such an action as it would likely lead to open war with Russia. As the invasion continues, an intelligence update from the British Ministry of Defence said that Russia had made minimal progress this week.The stuttering attack was reportedly initially planned by the Kremlin to be a aposlightning invasionapos, that would have seen them take the country in a matter of days and depose the standing government.  Instead, Russia finds itself struggling to take the major cities and urban centres, while negotiating with the government it sought to depose. The display of prams is just one sign this week of Russiaaposs barbarity. Experts have said that, after its failure to take the cities quickly, the Kremlin then turned to indiscriminate bombing of civilian targets. This week also saw a theatre in Mariupol that was sheltering around , civilians attacked. Serhiy Taruta, a Ukrainian politician, confirmed the atrocity and said hundreds remain unaccounted for. He added they cannot be evacuated because the rescue services in the city have been decimated by Russian forces.In a Facebook post, he wrote: No one understands. Services that are supposed to help are demolished, rescue and utility services... are physically destroyed.A lot of doctors have been killed. This means that all the survivors of the bombing will either die under the ruins of the theater, or have already died. title: huge five bed house sale
story: Huge five-bed house for sale for just under £million with odd resemblance to a prisonVisitors are welcomed into a huge front entrance, flanked by cascading Greek-style columns, and once inside, can park their car in a seven-car garage in Alberta, CanadaThe house is spread over two storeys and is surrounded by a brick wall with large security gates Image: HTTPS:WWW.REALTOR.CA REAL-ESTATE ByAlice PeacockNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsAn enormous five-bedroom mansion is on the market for a little less than £million with a slight catch - it looks uncannily like a prison. The sprawling property in Alberta, Canada, which is on the market for ,, , was built back in . It is spread over two storeys and is surrounded by a brick wall with large security gates at the front. Visitors are welcomed into a huge front entrance, flanked by cascading Greek-style columns, and once inside, can park their car in either a seven-car garage or a James Bond-style underground area with room for an additional three motors.  The estate agent has described the property’s two watchtowers as a sunroom and an observatory respectively, however a portion of viewers seem to think otherwise. Prospective buyers have commented on the watchtowers, commenting that they look like a prison’s observation tower looking over the house’s “yard”. Bemused viewers took to the popular online forum Reddit website to share their thoughts.  Must be a place for rich ex-convicts who want to be reminded of their time in the big house,” one user joked. Another referenced the prison drama Shawshank Redemption, featuring Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman, which shows the characters tunnelling out of prison and escaping to Mexico. I like that they paved the whole yard so you can’t discretely sprinkle sand down your pant leg from your escape tunnel. “Smart,” they said. Spread over . acres, the property boasts an indoor pool with two slides and a pool area to relax in, as well as a built-in BBQ area and steam room, for added luxury. A personal cinema offers space to nestle in and enjoy a good film, while a games room fitted out with a pool table and bar also features in the impressive property. Sporty types will be lured in by the gym and tennis court accompanying the property and a spacious kitchen with a commercial-grade stove is on offer for any foodie types. A grand wooden staircase takes residents up to the first floor, with five spacious bedrooms, four bathrooms and two smaller bathrooms. title: inside kyiv locals woken up
story: Inside Kyiv as locals woken up by Russian explosions and killing continuesJohn Sweeney reports from Kyiv, Ukraines capital, where the killing is continuing. However, he says Vladimir Putins army is not winning the war and is weakening its gripA Ukrainian policeman secures the area at a residential district that was damaged by shelling in Kyiv Image: REUTERSByJohn Sweeney in Kyiv:,  Mar |comments A Russian missile powered towards the heart of Kyiv before it was knocked out of the sky by a Ukrainian air defence rocket.The debris scissored to earth on the east bank of the Dnipro river, away from the centre of the city, blasting the top of a ten-storey apartment block, killing one person and injuring two, shattering windows in the whole neighbourhood, including a school, a local clinic and a kindergarten. Thankfully, most people were hiding in bunkers and survived. Maria, , and her little girl, Olga, four, were woken up by the explosion: “We felt it.” Maria pointed out a low building with very single window blown out: “That’s where Olga has her dancing classes.” But the most striking thing about the east bank was the absence of crumps and bangs. The Russian army has stopped moving forwards. Far from encircling the city, the eastern claw of Vladimir Putin ’s forces is weakening its grip. To the west, the Russians and the Ukrainians are locked in mortal combat, fighting for every street, every house. The dference is simple: the Ukrainians are fighting for their homes and their kids the Russians are fighting for one man in a high castle. The killing continues in Kyiv and across the whole of Ukraine but the big picture is that Vladimir Putin’s dogfood army is not winning the war. I call it the dogfood army because, a while back, a Russian army officer was sacked because he complained his boys were being fed “prime quality beef” which was, in fact, dogfood relabelled.The Ukrainians have found abandoned Russian tanks equipped with food rations with “eat-by” dates from . There are multiple videos of Russian soldiers scavenging for food in Ukraine. An army marches on its stomach. If it doesn’t eat, it doesn’t march.  It’s not just the food. “Any army who doesn’t look after its dead is in trouble,” said Johnny Mercer, the Tory MP for Plymouth and, in a previous le, a British army commando, who passed through Kyiv last week. The litter of Russian dead has become a commonplace the fact that the Russian soldiers don’t bother to pick up and bury their fallen comrades shows their morale is rock bottom.The second great weakness of the dogfood army is corruption. Michael Weiss, an American journalist who is writing a book on Russia ’s military intelligence service, the GRU, says: “there is mounting evidence that the Kremlin are fielding a Potemkin army. Their soldiers don’t want to fight. They’re abandoning tens of millions in kit. And there have been credible allegations of rampant corruption in the military with billions stolen by crooked officers.” The Russian army’s third great weakness is that its ultimate leader, Vladimir Putin, trusts no-one, like Stalin, not even himself. He was so paranoid about the army leaking his invasion plans that he told them two nights before D-Day. That meant that the generals have had to make it up as they were going along. The Ukrainians believe in their cause and are fighting like tigers. The dogfood army is hungry, scared, cheated by corrupt generals and led by a paranoiac who he sits at a table that screams theof his fear. Don’t be surprised, then, that the Russian army is not moving forwards. news world-news leaked-vladimir-putin-phone-call-"Putin speaks at Moscow rally hailing special operation in UkraineByDanya BazaraaSenior News Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Details of a phone call President Vladimir Putin made detailing his demands for peace with Ukraine have been reported.The Russian President rang the Turkish President, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, on Thursday afternoon and explained what his conditions were for a peace deal with Ukraine.Following the call, the BBC spoke to Mr Erdoganaposs leading adviser and spokesman, Ibrahim Kalin who was part of a small number of officials listening in on the call.One of the chief demands is that Ukraine should be neutral and not apply to join NATO, which Ukrainian President has already conceded to, the report says. There are also demands for Ukraine to undergo a disarmament process to make sure thereaposs no threat to Russia and protection for Russian as a language in Ukraine, reports said.Another demand was said to be about aposde-Nazicationapos which is deeply offensive to Zelensky, who is Jewish himself.  Other discussions involved the status of Donbas in eastern Ukraine, though no specic details were given about this. Putin reportedly said that some of the negotiations would need to be face to face with Zelensky, which the latter is said to be prepared for.  A peace deal could take a long time to reach and it will be a long time until Ukraine is able to rebuild the cities Russia has destroyed. Russia expanded its missile strikes to Lviv in the west of Ukraine as British intelligence suggested Vladimir Putinaposs invasion had made only minimal progress this week. Armed forces minister James Heappey said on Friday the early-morning attack on the city that has swelled with people sheltering from where in Ukraine showed Russia was broadening its strikes.  Lviv Mayor Andriy Sadovyi said several missiles hit a facility for repairing military planes near the cityaposs international airport and also damaged a bus repair site. Shelling around the capital of Kyiv also continued as the number of refugees estimated to have fled exceeded . million. title: tories rush ignore covid wait
story: Tories rush to ignore Covid while the wait for truth over pandemic bungle drags onWere now in a free-for-all and no one knows how to behave, says Paul Routledge, and this Covid confusion works to Boris Johnsons advantage. However, a new iant has emerged and cases are up by %British Prime Minister Boris Johnson Image: REUTERSopinionByPaul Routledge:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments For weeks, the politicians were very quiet about Covid, pretending it’s gone away.Then ministers suddenly got busy, lting all travel restrictions from today. We’re now in a free-for-all. Fingers crossed, because it’s a gamble with the nation’s health and the lives of the vulnerable. No mandatory masks on planes, trains and buses, or in schools or shops. That sounds correct, but the abolition of official rules brings confusion and uncertainty. In this do-it-yourself pandemic policy, who knows how to behave Boris Johnson, who uses the Ukraine war as a covering for his face , wants us to believe it’s all over. It isn’t. Driven by the super-infectious Omicron BA iant, new cases are up by %. There are , in hospital, with  on ventilators. Deaths on Wednesday numbered , bringing the seven-day total to . Protection gained by booster jabs is fast disappearing, and we’re still waiting for the vital fourth dose. It may come soon for the over s and vulnerable, but not until later in the year for the general population. With a hundred deaths being recorded every day, this feels like Covid complacency.And the Government is dragging its feet over the independent pandemic inquiry. It’s unlikely to take evidence before the winter – and not report until at least two years.This deliberate delay takes the verdict on the Great Tory Pandemic Bungle until well after the general election, thereby letting Boris Johnson off the hook. I don’t know about Covid being endemic, but we are being asked to live with endemic political corruption. *********** In , King James I described smoking tobacco as loathsome to the eye, hateful to the nose, harmful to the brain and dangerous to the lungs. And he likened the “black, stinking fume thereof” to the Stygian smoke in the bottomless pit of hell. I don’t know how he knew that because nobody who’s been there has ed to tell the tale. No matter. His diagnosis is correct. In , , people in England died from conditions related to the lethal ciggy. With addiction rates among - year olds up by %, anti-smoking tsar Javed Khan urges the Government to raise the age for buying fags to “, ,  or even ”. My father, a heavy smoker, died at . I’d raise the age to ... with written permission from both grandparents. *********** Anti-Ukraine war protesters who broke into the Belgravia mansion of sanctioned Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska found it empty.I half expected them to find Milord Peter Mandelson lolling in an armchair sipping a glass of hot water, his favourite tipple.He knew Deripaska “not very well” but well enough to be entertained on the yacht of Putin’s admirer in Corfu, where he joined a yoga session with his host. Pally Peter, in those days a Brussels bureaucrat, flattered oily Oleg as “not only wealthy but well-read, and voraciously interested in a constellation of social and economic ideas, as well as Russia’s future.” I’ll say. We haven’t heard much from Mandy about his wealthy Russian pals lately. I wonder why  *********** Early man’s greatest invention was the handle, which made stone tools more efficient for bashing, chopping and scraping, according to Liverpool University researchers. Sorry, Scouse pointy-heads. That honour belongs to the bed. title: woman drives four days 20
story: Woman drives for four days with  dogs crammed in car to flee UkraineOwner Olena Lukash is ing to Ukraine to save more animals in danger - but the -year-old needs money for food, medicine and fuel to continue her rescue missionOwner Olena Lukash with her French bulldogs Image: Kennedy News and MediaBySophie NorrisPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar |comments A brave dog owner crammed her  French bulldogs into a car and drove through Ukraine as Russian bombs fell overhead - and sheaposs preparing toto the warzone to save more aposdefenceless animalsapos. Olena Lukash initially aposdidnapost believe a war could startapos in her home country until Russian shells began to land near her house, just outside of Kyiv.However the -year-old soon realised she would have to save herfour-legged childrenfrom the terrying threat as she decided to flee her home and head for Poland.Photos show  of the dogs squeezed into the kennel owneraposs Hyundai Tucson for the four-day drive - the poor pooches blissfully unaware of the terror they were escaping. to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. Remarkably, after Olena and her husband Alexander left the dogs in Poland they then ed to their Russian-occupied town to rescue  more and then fled to Vinnitsa,  miles away from Kyiv.Next week, the breeder will face the same gruelling drive back to Poland, but Olena admits money is running out fast as they face a £ [₴,] bill each week just to feed the dogs.Olena, from Kyiv, Ukraine, said: My dogs are my children. My job is my dogs. These are all French Bulldogs - my favourite breed for  years now.I didnapost believe a war could start. The first week I thought that everything would end quickly, then shells began to fall near the house and I realised that I needed to save my four-legged children.I took the first batch of dogs,  dogs and  puppies, to Poland on March . The drive took me four days. There is a lot of traffic on the roads. I ed home when our village was occupied by Russian troops and took out the rest of the dogs and puppies,  dogs and  puppies.Now we are km away from the hostilities but I plan to take all my dogs to a safe place in Europe.I love my dogs very much. I am ready to do a lot to save the lives of defenceless animals. I have strength and doing for this.They are obedient and I am strong. I manage. Most importantly, we are all together and safe.Olena is now in Vinnitsa in central Ukraine with the remaining dogs but claims they need money for food, medicine and fuel to continue their rescue mission.Olena said: I am with dogs in Ukraine, the city of Vinnitsa, with my friend. We need funds for food, medicine for dogs and fuel for the car to continue on our way.Thousands of people write to me. I donapost even have time to read everything.I try to let people know that I need help. Inidual people help financially, the rest sympathise.All American friends are generally silent - they do not want to help.So far I have ed to Ukraine once. I need to do two or three more trips. I have never counted how much I spend on dogs, but I think that [£] a week would be enough for me to feed them all.It is impossible to count on medicines and assistance because this all happened spontaneously. Gasoline is very expensive now.I need to raise money for the long haul and find families for my puppies.The married animal lover claims she will continue to rescue other dogs as soon as she gets her to safety, even forming groups across neighbouring countries to ensure rescued dogs find a safe long-term home.Olena said: First I have to provide a safe place for my dogs in Europe then I will help other dogs from Ukraine.We have already created groups and selected people to deliver animals from Poland and Romania throughout Europe, but they also need financial assistance for fuel.It is a lot of work and I have very little energy now. Without my husband, I would not have coped with this situation.Do you have a dog story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. title: woman spends three years watering
story: Woman spends three years watering houseplant - before realising its made of plasticThe woman from China, said she bought the plant online and "took care of plant like a baby". The succulent had blue-coloured veins which changed colour over the years, leading to her believing it was growing nicelyThe plant had blue-coloured veins which changed colour over the years, leading to her believing the succulent was growing and developing nicelyBySamantha Mordi:,  Mar |commentsA woman lovingly watered a houseplant every single day for nearly three years before discovering it is actually made of plastic. Ms Liu shared images of the succulent on social media and admitted she felt silly after noticing her mistake. The woman from China, said she bought the plant online and took care of plant like a baby. However when she shared images online, she said she realised that she could not move the leaves with her hand and it soon dawned on her that it was actually made of plastic.. The plant had blue-coloured veins which changed colour over the years, leading to her believing the succulent was growing and developing nicely. She continued to water the plant over the subsequent years and believed it was growing well and looked healthy.  Adding she took care of the plant like a baby and watered it every single day. Admitting the discovery left her feeling stupid, she said that she could see the funny side. This comes as last year Caelie Wilkes religiously watered her houseplant for more than two years. The woman, who had a strict watering schedule for the plant was devastated when she found out that her plant wasnapost real.She told friends on Facebook that she feels as though the last two years had been a lie.It was only when she went to re-pot the succulent that she noticed it was fake. She said: I just wanted to keep good care of it. I absolutely loved my succulent. She explained that after finding a cute vase which suited it perfectly, she decided she would re-pot it. But as she started to pull it out of its original plastic container she saw that it was attached to a block of foam, and decorated with sand which was glued on top. She said: Tried my hardest to keep it looking its best, and itaposs completely plastic. Her story was shared to an Australian indoor plant group Facebook page, where a number of others admitted theyaposd also made the same mistake. One said: My friend at work always kills the plants because she doesn’t water them, so I put a fake one in the cafe. She watered it for a month before I told her it was fake. And another added: Another said: aposMy dad watered one of my mumaposs plants for a year after she died not realising it was fake. We had a good laugh about it, I bet mum had a good chuckle upstairs too. title: worlds most boring men revealed
story: Worlds most boring men revealed - see where your job and lestyle ranks on listA lestyle study into the science of boredom also revealed Britains dullest jobs - studying data, accountancy, cleaning and bankingSleeping was the number one boring hobby according to the studyImage: Getty ImagesByDanya BazaraaSenior News Reporter:,  Mar |comments The worldaposs most aposboringapos man has been described as a data analysis worker who likes sleeping and watching TV in a lestyle study.The study into the science of boredom revealed Britainaposs dullest jobs - studying data, accountancy, cleaning and banking. A team at Essex University who looked at the lestyle of  people also found that boredom was also linked to sitting in front of a television, bird-watching and smoking. Led by the Department of Psychologyaposs Dr Wijnand Van Tilburg the research revealed that stereotypically aposboringapos people are generally avoided because others pre-judge them and give them a wide berth. Dr Van Tilburg said: Ironically studying boredom is actually very interesting and has many real-le impacts. We found how persuasive perceptions of boredom are and what an impact this can have on people.  Perceptions can change but people may not take time to speak to those with aposboringapos jobs and hobbies and avoid them instead so they donapost get a chance to prove people wrong and break these negative stereotypes. The very fact that people choose to avoid them can lead to social ostracisation and increase loneliness leading to a really negative impact on their lives. The study also showed that people seen as boring seem to have low competence and little interpersonal warmth - but in reality may be at greater risk of harm, addiction and mental health issues. And despite the negative perception society needs people to work in accounting and banking. Bankers and accountants are highly capable and have power in society - perhaps we should try not to upset them and stereotype them as boring.  The top five aposmost boringapos jobs: . Data Analysis . Accounting . Tax insurance . Cleaning . Banking The top five aposmost excitingapos jobs . Performing arts . Science . Journalism . Health professional . Teaching The top five aposmost boringapos hobbies  Sleeping . Religion . Watching TV . Observing animals . title: worlds tallest model says struggles
story: Worlds tallest model says she struggles to meet men put off by ft in frameGiven the fact that the average man is reported to stand at ft ins – a foot shorter than the model – Ekaterina Lisina accepted that she’d had to make some compromises when determining her dating boundariesEkaterina Lisina said her height causes conflict when she is trying to find a partnerByAdam GoldsmithNews Reporter, PodcastsSamantha Mordi:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA Guinness world record holder who has the worldaposs longest legs has opened up about how her ft ins height impacts her love le. Tallest model in the world, Ekaterina Lisina spoke to former porn star, Alexis Texas on her podcast, Private Talks. She said that her height causes conflict when she is trying to find a partner. The Russian athlete and basketball player said she was anxious, when she realised she may take after her equally tall parents.Her mother and father are ft ins, the Daily Star reports.I was afraid because I know how kids and people generally react to height, and it’s not good,” she remembered.And, as she grew older, Ekaterina’s height also began to play an unhelpful role in her romantic le. “You know those problems, when you like a boy but he’s much shorter, or you like a tall boy but he doesnapost want to be with you because you are too tall for him, she explained. But, given the fact that the average man is reported to stand at ft ins – a foot shorter than the model – Ekaterina accepted that she’d had to make some compromises when determining her dating boundaries. “Probably ft in,” she revealed. “That’s the limit.” Asked by Alexis whether she’d ever been with anyone shorter than that, Ekaterina responded: “No, I think it’s already really low for me.The dference is over one foot a lot of girls can’t even handle a couple of centimetres’ dference and this is one foot.” The model added: “Height shouldn’t matter in the relationship, it shouldn’t be the most important thing.” Despite setting this boundary, Ekaterina admitted that she’d predominantly been dating men of a similar height while describing some of her requirements for a partner. “He should definitely care about me… Giving his attention, support financiallyhe can, she said. “But I think the most important thing is chemistry, and a spiritual connection… If there is no spiritual connection and evenyou like how the person looks it is not going to work anyway.” When she initially moved to LA from her home country, Ekaterina admitted that she struggled to adapt to the new type of man she encountered, and disliked dating apps. “I’m not a party person, I’m not a person who likes to go out,” she confessed. “I can’t say I met many people so I had to use a dating app because I don’t like to go out.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON World recordsGuiness Ltd." data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: midsummer beer happening tickets go on sale
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. title: aberdeenshire weight loss
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. title: hobbit huts
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Press and Journal. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an Evening Express ePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles.
